content.description: Climb 3 bolts of easy (5.10-) terrain before coming to double underclings.  A short and powerful crux leads to a good clipping jug.  Pull the final bulge and finish on balancy climbing to the anchors
content.location:
This route is where "the sweetest thing" used to be before it came down.  Immediately left of

Ground Zero

and right of stranger than friction.
Left of Natural Selection (5.12c), but shares the first bolt with that route.

content.description: A thought provoking start leads to easier climbing.  A balancy move out left onto a short arete leads to the start of the crux.  A powerful move to a sidepull will lead to a fun lieback crack finish.
content.location: Shares start with Atlas (5.11b) and Weight of the World (5.13c).  Right of the arete that is Trepanation (5.12c).  Left of Miscreant (5.13b).

content.description: The first crux starts around the third bolt and is sequency through a series of shallow side pulls. The middle of the climb is quite easy before you reach a cruxy and crimpy traverse.  Negotiate a small roof and you're clipping anchors.
content.location:
The route shares the first bolt with

Survival of the Fittest

, but then goes right. Located just right of the roof area.

content.description: Balancy climbing leads to a short slab section under an obvious roof.  The first crux involves pulling through the roof and clipping the next bolt.  More technical climbing before the chains.
content.location:
Located left of

Survival of the Fittest

and right of Miscreant.

content.description:
Climb positive flakes up and slightly left to a suddenly balancy transition into a series of underclings and edges over a slight bulge. Positive holds lead over the bulge to the base of a right-facing corner system where creative body positioning combined with some stemming lead up the corner and over the top. A short bit of easy slab concludes this fun and varied pitch.

There is an extension to this route called

Automatic Static

(5.11b), 16 bolts to anchors.

Interesting climbing with multiple cryptic sections. Starts on a broken drill flute pillar with chossy sections if you stay left. When following the bolt line which trends upward and right on the solid granite you will find sections which seem to climb much harder than comparable Quarry 11d routes. Crux is about 5/6/7th bolt areas when hold become scarce and a long reach comes in handy. Climbing to the left to avoid the crux but through the choss seems easier but sketchy. Overall, hard, and fun, more comparable to an Echo 11d. Based on current Quarry lines such as Leviathan 11d, Survival 12a, Raging Raptor 12a and many more.. this route seems harder than all which may be due to minimal traffic hiding more obvious sequences. Come climb it!
content.protection: 8 Bolts with 2 Rap ring anchors ( backed up by a chain to a third bolt)
content.location: Immediately right of Consumption 13c and left of Redrum. Neither of which are on the proj as of Jan 2016.

content.description:
A long fun route that starts of as Ground Zero but continues up and left past the anchors. A few moves that require manteling onto a ledge with a few balancy moves.

Make sure to use extended draws or long slings on the last two bolts of Ground Zero to prevent rope drag on this route. Quality climb that many people pass up.
content.location: Same start as Ground Zero, but after the slab section do not clip the anchors and instead traverse left and follow the bolts that head up the upper face. Rappel or lower using a 60 meter

content.description:
Shares the same first two bolts as Salubrious.

Scramble up to a ledge and make the high first clip. A low crux features a committing move from the left to the right to gain access to the second bolt. Head up and left with careful footwork over some slab to blocky features to get the third bolt.

From here it's some interesting movement over big features and a few ledges until you gain the not-ideal but still positive clipping stance for the anchors.

All together it climbs like a harder version of Peepshow, so bear in mind that some falls on this route are certainly better than others.
content.location: First route in the Right of the Roof section. Same start as Salubrious (11c). Extension to this route is Weight of the World (13c).
